intro: Gossypium latifolium f. tricuspidatum, commonly known as the broadleaf cotton, is a variant of the cotton plant characterized by its wide, heart-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is native to parts of Central and South America. The plant produces fluffy, white fibers that are used in textile manufacturing, similar to other cotton species. It thrives in warm climates with well-drained soil and requires a long growing season. This form is notable for its distinct leaf shape and potential for fiber production in specific ecological conditions.
